pullRequest.title: Cargo detectable
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
New detectable for Cargo package manager

commit.message: feat(detectable): Created classes necessary to support Cargo
feat(cargo): Created channels for creation of Cargo detectable
feat(cargo): Adding logic to Cargo.lock parser, created test for detectable
fix(cargo): Updated version of blackduck to 47.1.3, use new Crates forge
feat(cargo): Created custom detect result for missing Cargo.lock

nodes.bodyText: Can you make this multi line to be consistent with the rest of the file?
Can you make this multi line to be consistent with the rest of the file?
Is this upgrade required for Cargo support?
The extractor should take in the file and create the InputStream.

nodes.bodyText: Why are we taking in the cargo executable? It doesn't look like you use it anywhere.
Please make this multi-line for consistency.
Seems unrelated.
You do a null check on this later. Can we add an Optional getter instead?

commit.message: fix(cargo): Responded to feedback on PR
fix: Revised imports for Nullable annotation
fix: Add back space that was accidentally removed

nodes.bodyText: This check should occur in applicable(). Extractable is reserved for environment checking such as looking for executables.
Why do we need a CargoResolver if we aren't using the executable?
In the future, I would avoid making formatting changes that are unrelated to the code you are modifying in the PR. It's fine for now though.
I think this is a bit more readable. Also trimming a String has a meaning. I think the method name could be confusing because you aren't "trimming" in the traditional sense.

Could you add a unit test for this class? Test it with both valid and invalid inputs. Try to break your parser and make sure that it fails gracefully and not with null pointers. I think all of our parsers should have some kind of unit tests and not rely solely on the DetectableTest.
Could there be nulls in this list? I think they should be filtered out when the CargoLock is being created.

commit.message: feat(cargo): Added unit test for CargoLockParser

nodes.bodyText: Does this Toml library require an InputStream? If it can take a String we should do that instead. If not then this is fine.
If you are able to have the CargoLockParser take in a String instead of an InputStream then these resource files should removed in favor of a String within the unit test.

commit.message: feat(cargo): Cargo detectable now parses a String instead of an InputStream
feat(doc): Updated documentation to detail support for Cargo

nodes.bodyText:
I think we are only adding ticket numbers to the "Resolved Issues" section.
@stevebillings can you confirm?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,7 @@
 * The Yarn detector extracts project information from package.json files.
 * Added Yarn Detector support for dependencies that are missing a fuzzy version in a lockfile dependency declaration.
 * ${solution_name} logs policy violations when it is configured to [fail on policy violations](../properties/configuration/project/#fail-on-policy-violation-severities).
+* (IDETECT-1540) Detect now supports projects managed by the Cargo package manager.

commit.message: fix(docs): Removed ticket number from cargo support feature
